thread.title: Victoria Azarenka took a shot at Genie Bouchard for no apparent reason
thread.title_full: Victoria Azarenka took a shot at Genie Bouchard for no apparent reason

author: Chris Chase
title: Victoria Azarenka took a shot at Genie Bouchard for no apparent reason
text:
Victoria Azarenka took a shot at Genie Bouchard for no apparent reason USA Today Sports 5 days ago Chris Chase < PREVIOUS SLIDE SLIDE 1 of 3 NEXT SLIDE > (Getty Images) © Provided by USA Today Sports Former world No. 1 Victoria Azarenka, who battled injuries last year, has been back on the WTA all year — long enough where she can’t really use “yeah, I’m still coming back from injury” as an excuse about why her ranking is just No. 23 overall and No. 18 in the yearly race. So you’ll understand if they already cranky Azarenka was crankier still on Tuesday after she had to retire from a match in Wuhan down 4-6, 0-1, then had to answer this question:
AdChoices
“Genie Bouchard a couple of months ago said, yes, these experiences are learning experiences, but I’m kind of sick of learning. I’d like to get over it and move on. Can you relate to that a little bit?”
Though comparing the 21-year-old Bouchard, a one-time Slam finalist who was a top 10 player for all of nine months, to the two-time major champion and former No. 1 Azarenka is a stretch, the essence of the question is fine. For months it’s been “I’m coming back from injury, I’m coming back from injury” from Team Vika. At some point, as the interviewer notes, you have to start winning again, no? Azarenka didn’t appreciate the nuance. Before giving a rote answer about learning her body, this is how Vika started:
Well, I didn’t lose 11 matches in a row, so it’s a little bit different of a learning experience she has with herself. I’m not in the position to comment on what she’s done.
D mn. That’s Nike-on-Nike crime! Do you think Azarenka gets a text from a Nike rep after dissing a fellow endorser, gently telling her to never speak ill of others who wear the swoosh? Or is the person who’s tasked with writing said text too afraid that Vika would devil-wears-Prada her right out of a trip to Paris?
Though the whole thing is my favorite part, my favorite favorite part is Vika saying “I didn’t lose 11 matches in a row” with such conviction that you believe it as a fact. But Bouchard’s longest losing streak was six. She did lose 10 of 11 matches and 13 of 15, but she never came close to an 11-match losing streak.
But that’s the thing about talking trash. If it’s good, no one cares (or wants) to fact check.
